protocol_name: On-Cell Western Plate-Based Assay for Targeted Near-Infrared-Labeled Optical Imaging Agent Development: Receptor-Based Binding and Competition Assays
protocol_name_html: On-Cell Western Plate-Based Assay for Targeted Near-Infrared-Labeled Optical Imaging Agent Development: Receptor-Based Binding and Competition Assays
description:
This protocol is intended to illustrate the process for testing a particular cell type with the IRDye 800CW EGF for eventual use in vivo. A431 (epithelial carcinoma) cells are used in this example because of their over-expression of EGFR. Media considerations and certain cell characteristics will naturally alter this protocol if a different cell line is used.

 

Developed for:

 

Aerius,

Odyssey® Classic,

Odyssey CLx, and

Odyssey Sa

Infrared Imaging Systems
guidelines:
I. Required Reagents

LI-COR Reagents

  • IRDye 800CW EGF (P/N 926-08446)
  • CellTagTM 700 Stain (LI-COR, P/N 926-41090)
  • Odyssey® Blocking Buffer (PBS) (LI-COR, P/N 927-40000)

 

Additional Reagents

  • 1X PBS wash buffer
  • Tissue culture reagents (serum, DMEM, trypsin, 1X PBS)
  • 100% Tween® 20
  • 37% formaldehyde
  • 10% Triton® X-100
  • Costar™ 96-well Black Clear-Bottom Plate (Corning)

SPECIAL NOTE: Serum starvation of the cells is required to obtain maximal response.

 

II. Seeding, Stimulation, and Detection with IRDye 800CW EGF

 

"See STEPS"

 

 

 

 

III. Experimental Considerations

 

Proper selection of microplates can significantly affect the results of an analysis, as each plate has its own characteristics, including well depth, plate autofluorescence, and well-to-well signal crossover. Use the general considerations for microplate selection provided below.

 

  • On-Cell Western analyses use detection at the well surface with no liquid present. This results in minimal well-to-well signal spread, allowing the use of both clear and black-sided plates with clear bottoms. Do not use plates with white wells, since the autofluorescence from the white surface will create significant noise.
  • On-Cell Western assays require sterile plates for tissue culture growth. The following plates and focus offset settings are recommended by LI-COR Biosciences. Please be aware that manufacturers’ specifications for culture plates are subject to change.
  • Protect plates from light before imaging to ensure highest sensitivity. When storing plates after imaging, the plates should remain protected from light at 4 °C.

Well

Well

96 Flat Nunc 161093, 165305 3.0 mm 3.0 mm
96 Flat BD Falcon 353075, 353948 3.0 mm 3.0 mm
96 Flat Corning 3603 3.0 mm 3.0 mm
384 Flat Nunc 164688, 164730 3.0 mm 3.0 mm
384 Flat BD Falcon 353961, 353962 3.0 mm 3.0 mm

 

Focus Offset Optimization - Plates deviating from LI-COR recommendations may require lower or higher focus offsets for optimal resolution and detection.

 

Instrument

Focus Offset

Determination (mm)
Odyssey Classic & Odyssey CLx 0.5, 1.0, 2.0, 3.0 & 4.0
Odyssey Sa & Aerius 1.7, 2.0, 3.0 & 4.0

 

Alternatively, consult the plate manufacturer to obtain the measured distance from the skirt to the bottom of the plate. Microplates are required to have a distance of no more than 4.0 mm from the instrument surface to the target detection area of the plate.

 

Intensity Setting Optimization – Intensity settings may need to be optimized depending on results. If signal is weak or saturated, try the suggested intensity settings in the table below to achieve optimal results.

*The Image Studio AutoScan function for the Odyssey CLx alleviates the need to scan the plate at multiple intensity settings.

components.data: Allow A431 cell growth in a 100-mm dish in DMEM containing 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS; ATCC 30-2020) and 1% PEN/STREP (Gibco®) using standard tissue culture proce- dures until cells reach 80% - 90% confluency (~1.5 x 107 cells).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Allow A431 cell growth in a 100-mm dish in DMEM containing 10% fetal bovine serum (FBS; ATCC 30-2020) and 1% PEN/STREP (Gibco®) using standard tissue culture proce- dures until cells reach 80% - 90% confluency (~1.5 x 107 cells).

components.data: Remove growth medium, wash cells with sterile 1X PBS, and trypsinize cells.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove growth medium, wash cells with sterile 1X PBS, and trypsinize cells.

components.data: Neutralize displaced cells with culture medium and pellet by centrifugation.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Neutralize displaced cells with culture medium and pellet by centrifugation.

components.data: Remove supernatant and resuspend cell pellet in remaining medium by manually tapping the collection tube. To maintain cell integrity, avoid vigorous pipetting or vortexing to re- suspend cells.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove supernatant and resuspend cell pellet in remaining medium by manually tapping the collection tube. To maintain cell integrity, avoid vigorous pipetting or vortexing to re- suspend cells.

components.data: Dilute cells to 20 mL in complete medium and count cells using a hemocytometer.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dilute cells to 20 mL in complete medium and count cells using a hemocytometer.

components.data: Dilute cells with complete medium to a concentration of 200,000 cells/mL.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dilute cells with complete medium to a concentration of 200,000 cells/mL.

components.data: Gently mix the cell suspension thoroughly.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Gently mix the cell suspension thoroughly.

components.data: Under sterile conditions, dispense 200 μL of the cell suspension per well in a 96-well plate (40,000 cells plated per well).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Under sterile conditions, dispense 200 μL of the cell suspension per well in a 96-well plate (40,000 cells plated per well).

components.data: Incubate cells and monitor cell density until cells are ~80 - 90% confluent in each well.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate cells and monitor cell density until cells are ~80 - 90% confluent in each well.

components.data: Warm serum-free medium (DMEM; Gibco®) to 37 °C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Warm serum-free medium (DMEM; Gibco®) to 37 °C.

components.data: Remove complete medium from the 96-well plate by aspiration or inversion of the plate and blot excess medium by tapping the inverted plate gently on a tissue.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove complete medium from the 96-well plate by aspiration or inversion of the plate and blot excess medium by tapping the inverted plate gently on a tissue.

components.data: Replace medium with 200 μL of pre-warmed, serum-free medium per well and incubate 4 hours at 37 °C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Replace medium with 200 μL of pre-warmed, serum-free medium per well and incubate 4 hours at 37 °C.

components.data: Prepare a dilution series of reagents for the binding and competition assays in a separate 96-well deep well plate as described in Figures 1 and 2.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare a dilution series of reagents for the binding and competition assays in a separate 96-well deep well plate as described in Figures 1 and 2.

components.data: Prepare 2-fold serial dilutions of IRDye® 800CW EGF ranging from 1.0 ng/mL to 500 ng/mL according to the experiment layout shown in Figure 1.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare 2-fold serial dilutions of IRDye® 800CW EGF ranging from 1.0 ng/mL to 500 ng/mL according to the experiment layout shown in Figure 1.

components.data: Binding Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Prepare 1 mL of 1 μg/mL IRDye 800CW EGF in DMEM.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare 1 mL of 1 μg/mL IRDye 800CW EGF in DMEM.

components.data: Binding Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Wells 1 and 2 are background controls and contain no IRDye 800CW EGF.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wells 1 and 2 are background controls and contain no IRDye 800CW EGF.

components.data: Binding Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Do not store; proceed immediately to step 21.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Do not store; proceed immediately to step 21.

components.data: Binding Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Prepare 2-fold serial dilutions of unlabeled EGF diluted in DMEM ranging from 0.06 to 16 μg/mL according to the experiment layout shown in Figure 2.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare 2-fold serial dilutions of unlabeled EGF diluted in DMEM ranging from 0.06 to 16 μg/mL according to the experiment layout shown in Figure 2.

components.data: Competition Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Prepare 1 mL of 32 μg/mL unlabeled EGF in DMEM.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Prepare 1 mL of 32 μg/mL unlabeled EGF in DMEM.

components.data: Competition Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Do not store; proceed immediately to step 21.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Do not store; proceed immediately to step 21.

components.data: Competition Assay
components.name: Section

components.data: Retrieve cell-containing plate from 37 °C incubator. Remove starvation medium from cells by aspiration or inversion of the plate and blot excess medium by tapping plate gently on tissue.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Retrieve cell-containing plate from 37 °C incubator. Remove starvation medium from cells by aspiration or inversion of the plate and blot excess medium by tapping plate gently on tissue.

components.data: Transfer 100 μL Binding Assay mixtures to rows A-C of the plate and 100 μL Competition Assay mixtures to rows D-F into the cell-containing wells. Use a multi-channel pipette and transfer these mixtures quickly (~20 sec), as cellular responses are quick.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Transfer 100 μL Binding Assay mixtures to rows A-C of the plate and 100 μL Competition Assay mixtures to rows D-F into the cell-containing wells. Use a multi-channel pipette and transfer these mixtures quickly (~20 sec), as cellular responses are quick.

components.data: Incubate at 37 °C for 2 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at 37 °C for 2 minutes.

components.data:
Prepare fresh Fixing Solution as follows:
 
1X PBS 45.0 mL
37% Formaldehyde 5.0 mL
3.7% Formaldehyde 50.0 mL
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare fresh Fixing Solution as follows:
 
1X PBS 45.0 mL
37% Formaldehyde 5.0 mL
3.7% Formaldehyde 50.0 mL

components.data: Remove EGF-containing medium by aspiration or inversion.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove EGF-containing medium by aspiration or inversion.

components.data: Immediately fix cells with the addition of 150 μL of fresh Fixing Solution and incubate at room temperature (RT) for 20 minutes with no shaking. Add the Fixing Solution carefully by pipetting down the side of the wells to avoid detaching the cells.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Immediately fix cells with the addition of 150 μL of fresh Fixing Solution and incubate at room temperature (RT) for 20 minutes with no shaking. Add the Fixing Solution carefully by pipetting down the side of the wells to avoid detaching the cells.

components.data:
Prepare Triton® Washing Solution as follows:
 
1X PBS 495 mL
10% Triton X-100 5 mL
1X PBS + 0.1% Triton X-100
 500 mL
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Prepare Triton® Washing Solution as follows:
 
1X PBS 495 mL
10% Triton X-100 5 mL
1X PBS + 0.1% Triton X-100
 500 mL

components.data: Remove the Fixing Solution by aspiration.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the Fixing Solution by aspiration.

components.data: Wash with 200 μL of Triton Washing Solution for 5 minutes per wash to permeabilize the cells. (wash 1/4)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash with 200 μL of Triton Washing Solution for 5 minutes per wash to permeabilize the cells. (wash 1/4)

source_data.protocol_name_html: On-Cell Western Plate-Based Assay for Targeted Near-Infrared-Labeled Optical Imaging Agent Development: Receptor-Based Binding and Competition Assays
source_data.annotation:
NOTES: 

  • Allow each wash to shake on a rotator for 5 minutes at RT.
  • Do not allow cells/wells to become dry during washing. Add each wash immediately after the preceding wash is removed.
source_data.thread_text:
NOTES: 

  • Allow each wash to shake on a rotator for 5 minutes at RT.
  • Do not allow cells/wells to become dry during washing. Add each wash immediately after the preceding wash is removed.
source_data.body:
NOTES: 

  • Allow each wash to shake on a rotator for 5 minutes at RT.
  • Do not allow cells/wells to become dry during washing. Add each wash immediately after the preceding wash is removed.

components.data: Remove the Triton Washing Solution by aspiration or inversion.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the Triton Washing Solution by aspiration or inversion.

components.data: To each well, carefully add 150 μL of LI-COR Odyssey® Blocking Buffer (P/N 927-40000) + 0.1% Tween® 20 down the side of the wells, and incubate for 1 hour at RT with moderate shaking on a rotating platform.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: To each well, carefully add 150 μL of LI-COR Odyssey® Blocking Buffer (P/N 927-40000) + 0.1% Tween® 20 down the side of the wells, and incubate for 1 hour at RT with moderate shaking on a rotating platform.

components.data: IRDye® 800CW EGF will be detected in the 800 nm channel. CellTag™ 700 Stain is a cell stain that can be used to normalize the signal from binding of the labeled EGF, to correct for variations in cell number from well to well. CellTag 700 Stain will be detected in the 700 nm channel.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: IRDye® 800CW EGF will be detected in the 800 nm channel. CellTag™ 700 Stain is a cell stain that can be used to normalize the signal from binding of the labeled EGF, to correct for variations in cell number from well to well. CellTag 700 Stain will be detected in the 700 nm channel.

components.data: Add 50 μL of LI-COR Odyssey Blocking Buffer + 0.1% Tween 20 to Well 1. This will serve as a control for any potential background.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 50 μL of LI-COR Odyssey Blocking Buffer + 0.1% Tween 20 to Well 1. This will serve as a control for any potential background.

components.data: Dilute 0.1 mM CellTag 700 Stain 1:500 in Odyssey Blocking Buffer. Add 50 μL to each well (except Well 1) and incubate for 1 hour with gentle shaking.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dilute 0.1 mM CellTag 700 Stain 1:500 in Odyssey Blocking Buffer. Add 50 μL to each well (except Well 1) and incubate for 1 hour with gentle shaking.

components.data: Wash the plate with Tween Washing Solution by gently adding solution down the side of the wells to avoid detaching the cells. Use a generous amount of solution (200 μL/well). (wash 1/5)

components.data: After final wash, remove wash solution completely from wells. Turn the plate upside down and tap or blot gently on paper towels to remove traces of wash solution. For best results, scan plate immediately; plates may also be stored at 4 °C for up to several weeks (protected from light).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After final wash, remove wash solution completely from wells. Turn the plate upside down and tap or blot gently on paper towels to remove traces of wash solution. For best results, scan plate immediately; plates may also be stored at 4 °C for up to several weeks (protected from light).
